item.title: The Gulf Between Libertarians and Other Social Theorists
item.description: I donâ€™t know why I have never considered it before, but Ross Kenyon is correct: Methodologically, libertarians and Austrians see the world largely as aggregated individuals, compared to other social theorists who mainly consider the world through group level dynamics.
